zone.line: He paused, and ere he could resume, I cried
First who art thou... before thy memory
feared
loved & hated
I did acted, suffered, suffered, did, & died
And if the flame which
spark with which Heaven lit my
spirit
had with with purer nutriment soul
Earth from a purer flask had supplied
thus
Corruption would not now so much inherit
Of what was once Rousseau I leave
nor this disguise
within which still disdains
Stained the pure to wear it.
that which should disdain
which ought to have disdained to wear

line.del: If I have been extinguished, yet there then rise

zone.line: A thousand beacons from the spark I bore.—

line.del: And then the shape turned that which mi

zone.line: And who are those chained to the the car? the Wise
they who wore
great the unforgotten the supreme
The mighty the immortal

line.del: Such were they called; and their wisdom

zone.line: Mitres & helms & crowns, or wreathes of light
Signs of
Of the soul thoughts empire over thought,
